getInTouch_location: 7005 RCEC Building, 128 Academia Road, Section 2, Nankang, Taipei 11529, Taiwan
stationPage_help1: This function presents the relevant information of the stations in the form of a station distribution map and a station information list (Figure 1). The four icons at the bottom left of the map, from top to bottom, are the buttons for filtering stations , display effects , locking the map , and expanding the map . The filtering function is used to filter the number of stations, the display effects are used to change the way symbols are presented on the map, such as size, transparency, cluster display, and the data represented by the symbol color. The locking map function controls whether the base map can be moved or zoomed in and out, and the expanding map is used to extend the width of the map display. When opened, the data list will be displayed below the map.
dataPage_help1: The data displays a list of scanned images of seismic record sheets. There are two icons at the bottom left, respectively the buttons for filtering stations and expanding the map . Using the filter function , users can filter the displayed data based on date range and stations. Clicking the file name allows you to preview the image (Figure 3), and clicking the data row allows you to select the file for download. After selecting the desired files (up to 50 at a time), press the Download Image Files button at the top right to download the image archive.
